dt: {bc}the strength of a solution or the concentration of a substance in solution as determined by {d_link|titration|titration}

dt.t: … if the analyst is using an oxalic acid solution to titrate a solution of calcium oxide, the {wi}titer{/wi} of the oxalic acid solution would be expressed as its CaO {wi}titer{/wi}, or the weight of CaO that is consumed by 1mL of the oxalic acid solution.

dt: {bc}a measure of the concentration of a substance (such as an antibody) in a blood sample that is obtained by subjecting the sample to serial dilutions (as with saline) to determine the maximum dilution at which the sample retains a specific activity (such as neutralizing an antigen) and that is often expressed as a ratio (such as 1:200)

dt.t: I have examples of people who clearly were infected who are antibody negative. They probably have such a low {wi}titer{/wi} of antibody that it's below the level of the cutoff.
The Blood Center will also ensure that the plasma has high {wi}titers{/wi} of antibodies against the coronavirus.

dt: {bc}a test for obtaining a blood titer

et: French {it}titre{/it} title, proportion of gold or silver in a coin, from Old French {it}title{/it} inscription, title
shortdef: the strength of a solution or the concentration of a substance in solution as determined by titration

a measure of the concentration of a substance (such as an antibody) in a blood sample that is obtained by subjecting the sample to serial dilutions (as with saline) to determine the maximum dilution at which the sample retains a specific activity (such as neutralizing an antigen) and that is often expressed as a ratio (such as 1:200); also : a test for obtaining a blood titer —often used before another noun

dt.t: I have examples of people who clearly were infected who are antibody negative. They probably have such a low {wi}titer{/wi} of antibody that it's below the level of the cutoff.
The Blood Center will also ensure that the plasma has high {wi}titers{/wi} of antibodies against the coronavirus.
